message.content: give me it here chunked up one at a time so i can easily copy and paste each chunk

content.text:
Here are the SQL chunks to copy and paste one at a time:

## Chunk 1: Migration Jobs Table
```sql
-- Migration Jobs table - tracks overall migration process
CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS public.migration_jobs (
  id UUID PRIMARY KEY DEFAULT gen_random_uuid(),
  organization_id UUID NOT NULL REFERENCES public.organizations(id) ON DELETE CASCADE,
  source_system VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL DEFAULT 'goteamup',
  status VARCHAR(20) NOT NULL DEFAULT 'pending',
  total_records INTEGER DEFAULT 0,
  processed_records INTEGER DEFAULT 0,
  successful_records INTEGER DEFAULT 0,
  failed_records INTEGER DEFAULT 0,
  ai_analysis JSONB,
  field_mappings JSONB,
  started_at TIMESTAMPTZ,
  completed_at TIMESTAMPTZ,
  created_by UUID REFERENCES auth.users(id),
  created_at TIMESTAMPTZ DEFAULT NOW(),
  updated_at TIMESTAMPTZ DEFAULT NOW(),
  CONSTRAINT migration_status_check CHECK (status IN ('pending', 'uploading', 'analyzing', 'mapping', 'processing', 'completed', 'failed', 'cancelled'))
);
```

## Chunk 2: Migration Files Table
```sql
-- Migration Files table - stores uploaded file information
CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS public.migration_files (
  id UUID PRIMARY KEY DEFAULT gen_random_uuid(),
  migration_job_id UUID NOT NULL REFERENCES public.migration_jobs(id) ON DELETE CASCADE,
  organization_id UUID NOT NULL REFERENCES public.organizations(id) ON DELETE CASCADE,
  file_name VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL,
  file_size BIGINT NOT NULL,
  file_type VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
  storage_path TEXT NOT NULL,
  raw_data JSONB,
  parsed_headers TEXT[],
  row_count INTEGER,
  status VARCHAR(20) DEFAULT 'uploaded',
  error_message TEXT,
  created_at TIMESTAMPTZ DEFAULT NOW(),
  CONSTRAINT file_status_check CHECK (status IN ('uploaded', 'parsing', 'parsed', 'failed'))
);
```

## Chunk 3: Migration Records Table
```sql
-- Migration Records table - individual record processing tracking
CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS public.migration_records (
  id UUID PRIMARY KEY DEFAULT gen_random_uuid(),
  migration_job_id UUID NOT NULL REFERENCES public.migration_jobs(id) ON DELETE CASCADE,
  organization_id UUID NOT NULL REFERENCES public.organizations(id) ON DELETE CASCADE,
  source_record_id VARCHAR(255),
  record_type VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
  source_data JSONB NOT NULL,
  mapped_data JSONB,
  target_id UUID,
  target_table VARCHAR(50),
  status VARCHAR(20) DEFAULT 'pending',
  error_message TEXT,
  error_details JSONB,
  retry_count INTEGER DEFAULT 0,
  processed_at TIMESTAMPTZ,
  created_at TIMESTAMPTZ DEFAULT NOW(),
  CONSTRAINT record_status_check CHECK (status IN ('pending', 'processing', 'success', 'failed', 'skipped', 'duplicate')),
  CONSTRAINT record_type_check CHECK (record_type IN ('client', 'membership', 'payment', 'attendance', 'class', 'form'))
);
```

## Chunk 4: Field Mappings Table
```sql
-- Field Mappings table - AI-generated and user-confirmed field mappings
CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS public.migration_field_mappings (
  id UUID PRIMARY KEY DEFAULT gen_random_uuid(),
  migration_job_id UUID NOT NULL REFERENCES public.migration_jobs(id) ON DELETE CASCADE,
  organization_id UUID NOT NULL REFERENCES public.organizations(id) ON DELETE CASCADE,
  source_field VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL,
  target_field VARCHAR(255),
  target_table VARCHAR(50),
  data_type VARCHAR(50),
  transformation_rule JSONB,
  ai_confidence DECIMAL(3,2),
  user_confirmed BOOLEAN DEFAULT FALSE,
  sample_values JSONB,
  created_at TIMESTAMPTZ DEFAULT NOW(),
  updated_at TIMESTAMPTZ DEFAULT NOW(),
  UNIQUE(migration_job_id, source_field)
);
```

## Chunk 5: Migration Conflicts Table
```sql
-- Migration Conflicts table - handles duplicate detection and resolution
CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS public.migration_conflicts (
  id UUID PRIMARY KEY DEFAULT gen_random_uuid(),
  migration_job_id UUID NOT NULL REFERENCES public.migration_jobs(id) ON DELETE CASCADE,
  migration_record_id UUID NOT NULL REFERENCES public.migration_records(id) ON DELETE CASCADE,
  organization_id UUID NOT NULL REFERENCES public.organizations(id) ON DELETE CASCADE,
  conflict_type VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
  existing_record_id UUID,
  existing_data JSONB,
  incoming_data JSONB,
  resolution_strategy VARCHAR(50),
  resolved_by UUID REFERENCES auth.users(id),
  resolved_at TIMESTAMPTZ,
  created_at TIMESTAMPTZ DEFAULT NOW(),
  CONSTRAINT conflict_type_check CHECK (conflict_type IN ('duplicate_email', 'duplicate_phone', 'data_mismatch', 'validation_error')),
  CONSTRAINT resolution_check CHECK (resolution_strategy IN ('skip', 'update', 'create_new', 'merge', 'manual'))
);
```

## Chunk 6: Migration Logs Table
```sql
-- Migration Logs table - detailed logging for debugging and audit
CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS public.migration_logs (
  id UUID PRIMARY KEY DEFAULT gen_random_uuid(),
  migration_job_id UUID NOT NULL REFERENCES public.migration_jobs(id) ON DELETE CASCADE,
  organization_id UUID NOT NULL REFERENCES public.organizations(id) ON DELETE CASCADE,
  level VARCHAR(20) NOT NULL,
  message TEXT NOT NULL,
  details JSONB,
  created_at TIMESTAMPTZ DEFAULT NOW(),
  CONSTRAINT log_level_check CHECK (level IN ('debug', 'info', 'warning', 'error', 'critical'))
);
```

## Chunk 7: Create Indexes
```sql
-- Create indexes for performance
CREATE INDEX IF NOT EXISTS idx_migration_jobs_org ON public.migration_jobs(organization_id);
CREATE INDEX IF NOT EXISTS idx_migration_jobs_status ON public.migration_jobs(status);
CREATE INDEX IF NOT EXISTS idx_migration_records_job ON public.migration_records(migration_job_id);
CREATE INDEX IF NOT EXISTS idx_migration_records_status ON public.migration_records(status);
CREATE INDEX IF NOT EXISTS idx_migration_conflicts_job ON public.migration_conflicts(migration_job_id);
CREATE INDEX IF NOT EXISTS idx_migration_logs_job ON public.migration_logs(migration_job_id);
```

## Chunk 8: Enable RLS
```sql
-- Enable RLS (Row Level Security)
ALTER TABLE public.migration_jobs ENABLE ROW LEVEL SECURITY;
ALTER TABLE public.migration_files ENABLE ROW LEVEL SECURITY;
ALTER TABLE public.migration_records ENABLE ROW LEVEL SECURITY;
ALTER TABLE public.migration_field_mappings ENABLE ROW LEVEL SECURITY;
ALTER TABLE public.migration_conflicts ENABLE ROW LEVEL SECURITY;
ALTER TABLE public.migration_logs ENABLE ROW LEVEL SECURITY;
```

## Chunk 9: Drop Existing Policies
```sql
-- Drop existing policies if they exist
DROP POLICY IF EXISTS "migration_jobs_org_access" ON public.migration_jobs;
DROP POLICY IF EXISTS "migration_files_org_access" ON public.migration_files;
DROP POLICY IF EXISTS "migration_records_org_access" ON public.migration_records;
DROP POLICY IF EXISTS "field_mappings_org_access" ON public.migration_field_mappings;
DROP POLICY IF EXISTS "migration_conflicts_org_access" ON public.migration_conflicts;
DROP POLICY IF EXISTS "migration_logs_org_access" ON public.migration_logs;
```

## Chunk 10: Create RLS Policies
```sql
-- Migration Jobs policies
CREATE POLICY "migration_jobs_org_access" ON public.migration_jobs
  FOR ALL USING (
    organization_id IN (
      SELECT organization_id FROM public.users WHERE id = auth.uid()
    )
  );

-- Migration Files policies
CREATE POLICY "migration_files_org_access" ON public.migration_files
  FOR ALL USING (
    organization_id IN (
      SELECT organization_id FROM public.users WHERE id = auth.uid()
    )
  );

-- Migration Records policies
CREATE POLICY "migration_records_org_access" ON public.migration_records
  FOR ALL USING (
    organization_id IN (
      SELECT organization_id FROM public.users WHERE id = auth.uid()
    )
  );

-- Field Mappings policies
CREATE POLICY "field_mappings_org_access" ON public.migration_field_mappings
  FOR ALL USING (
    organization_id IN (
      SELECT organization_id FROM public.users WHERE id = auth.uid()
    )
  );

-- Migration Conflicts policies
CREATE POLICY "migration_conflicts_org_access" ON public.migration_conflicts
  FOR ALL USING (
    organization_id IN (
      SELECT organization_id FROM public.users WHERE id = auth.uid()
    )
  );

-- Migration Logs policies
CREATE POLICY "migration_logs_org_access" ON public.migration_logs
  FOR ALL USING (
    organization_id IN (
      SELECT organization_id FROM public.users WHERE id = auth.uid()
    )
  );
```

## Chunk 11: Helper Functions
```sql
-- Function to update migration job progress
CREATE OR REPLACE FUNCTION public.update_migration_progress(
  p_job_id UUID,
  p_processed INTEGER DEFAULT NULL,
  p_successful INTEGER DEFAULT NULL,
  p_failed INTEGER DEFAULT NULL
)
RETURNS VOID AS $$
BEGIN
  UPDATE public.migration_jobs
  SET 
    processed_records = COALESCE(p_processed, processed_records),
    successful_records = COALESCE(p_successful, successful_records),
    failed_records = COALESCE(p_failed, failed_records),
    updated_at = NOW()
  WHERE id = p_job_id;
END;
$$ LANGUAGE plpgsql SECURITY DEFINER;

-- Function to log migration activity
CREATE OR REPLACE FUNCTION public.log_migration_activity(
  p_job_id UUID,
  p_level VARCHAR(20),
  p_message TEXT,
  p_details JSONB DEFAULT NULL
)
RETURNS VOID AS $$
DECLARE
  v_org_id UUID;
BEGIN
  SELECT organization_id INTO v_org_id
  FROM public.migration_jobs
  WHERE id = p_job_id;
  
  INSERT INTO public.migration_logs (
    migration_job_id,
    organization_id,
    level,
    message,
    details
  ) VALUES (
    p_job_id,
    v_org_id,
    p_level,
    p_message,
    p_details
  );
END;
$$ LANGUAGE plpgsql SECURITY DEFINER;
```

## Chunk 12: Grant Permissions
```sql
-- Grant permissions
GRANT ALL ON public.migration_jobs TO authenticated;
GRANT ALL ON public.migration_files TO authenticated;
GRANT ALL ON public.migration_records TO authenticated;
GRANT ALL ON public.migration_field_mappings TO authenticated;
GRANT ALL ON public.migration_conflicts TO authenticated;
GRANT ALL ON public.migration_logs TO authenticated;
GRANT EXECUTE ON FUNCTION public.update_migration_progress TO authenticated;
GRANT EXECUTE ON FUNCTION public.log_migration_activity TO authenticated;
```

## Chunk 13: Storage Bucket (Optional - Run in Supabase Dashboard)
```sql
-- Create storage bucket for migration files (run in Supabase Dashboard)
INSERT INTO storage.buckets (id, name, public) 
VALUES ('migrations', 'migrations', false);
```

## Chunk 14: Storage Policies (Optional - Run in Supabase Dashboard)
```sql
-- Storage policies for migrations bucket
CREATE POLICY "Authenticated users can upload migration files" ON storage.objects
  FOR INSERT WITH CHECK (bucket_id = 'migrations' AND auth.role() = 'authenticated');

CREATE POLICY "Users can view their own migration files" ON storage.objects
  FOR SELECT USING (bucket_id = 'migrations' AND auth.uid()::text = (storage.foldername(name))[1]);

CREATE POLICY "Users can delete their own migration files" ON storage.objects
  FOR DELETE USING (bucket_id = 'migrations' AND auth.uid()::text = (storage.foldername(name))[1]);
```

Run each chunk in order. The last two chunks (13 & 14) are for storage and may need to be run in the Supabase Dashboard's Storage section.

message.content:
This session is being continued from a previous conversation that ran out of context. The conversation is summarized below:
Analysis:
Let me chronologically analyze the conversation to ensure complete coverage:

1. **Initial Request**: User requested a pull from GitHub and reported messaging issues with messages stuck in "pending" status instead of being delivered.

2. **SQL Fixes for Messaging**: Multiple attempts to fix the in-app messaging system:
   - First attempt failed due to non-existent "lead_id" column
   - Second attempt failed due to non-existent "sent_at" column
   - User warned about syntax errors
   - Created adaptive SQL with column checking, but had apostrophe syntax errors
   - Finally fixed with clean SQL that successfully updated 10 messages

3. **API and Frontend Updates**: Updated message sending API and UnifiedMessaging component for proper in-app message handling and dark mode support.

4. **Conversation Loading Issues**: User reported "No conversations yet" despite messages existing:
   - Created get_all_conversations function with multiple fixes for column conflicts
   - Successfully returned conversation data

5. **UI Issues**: User provided screenshot showing light mode input and missing "In-App" option:
   - Applied dark mode styling throughout
   - Added "In-App" as default message type
   - Fixed message loading to use conversation_id

6. **Major Migration System Request**: User requested comprehensive GoTeamUp data migration system:
   - Emphasized avoiding timeout errors
   - Wanted AI-powered extraction
   - Required UI in settings area
   - Multiple file creation and API endpoints

7. **SQL Deployment**: User requested SQL chunks for copy-paste
   - Created chunked SQL statements
   - User confirmed all SQL successful

8. **Settings Navigation Issue**: User couldn't see migrations tab
   - Updated SettingsSidebar to add Migrations link
   - Committed and pushed changes

9. **Vercel Deployment**: User reported deployment error
   - Attempted to check deployment status with CLI
   - Commands showed deployment succeeded with warnings about Edge Runtime

The conversation shows a progression from fixing messaging issues to implementing a comprehensive migration system, with the final focus on deployment troubleshooting.

Summary:
1. **Primary Request and Intent:**
   - Fix in-app messaging between gym owners and clients where messages were stuck in "pending" status
   - Fix conversation loading showing "No conversations yet" despite messages existing  
   - Apply dark mode to messaging interface and add "In-App" as messaging option
   - Create comprehensive data migration system from GoTeamUp that:
     - Handles huge amounts of data without timeout errors
     - Uses AI to sort and extract client data (name, email, phone, address, forms, payments, attendance)
     - Provides UI in settings area under "Migrations" heading
     - Includes instructions for gym owners on data gathering and formatting
     - Processes everything in one go with AI pulling data and creating profiles
   - Fix deployment issues with Vercel CLI

2. **Key Technical Concepts:**
   - Supabase (PostgreSQL) with Row Level Security (RLS)
   - Next.js 14 with TypeScript
   - Real-time messaging with conversation_id association
   - Database triggers for automatic status updates
   - AI-powered data extraction using GPT-4
   - Asynchronous background processing to avoid timeouts
   - Multi-tenant architecture with organization_id isolation
   - File upload handling (CSV/Excel up to 100MB)
   - Vercel deployment and Edge Runtime compatibility

3. **Files and Code Sections:**
   - `/Users/Sam/scripts/fix-inapp-messaging-adaptive.sql`
      - Final working SQL for fixing pending messages
      - Successfully updated 10 messages to delivered status
      ```sql
      UPDATE public.messages
      SET status = 'delivered', updated_at = NOW()
      WHERE (channel = 'in_app' OR channel = 'In-App' OR 
             type = 'in_app' OR type = 'In-App' OR
             (to IS NULL))
        AND status = 'pending';
      ```

   - `/Users/Sam/app/components/UnifiedMessaging.tsx`
      - Applied dark mode styling throughout
      - Fixed message loading to use conversation_id
      - Added "In-App" as default message type
      ```typescript
      const [messageType, setMessageType] = useState<
        "sms" | "whatsapp" | "email" | "in_app"
      >("in_app");
      ```

   - `/Users/Sam/supabase/migrations/20250912_goteamup_migration_system.sql`
      - Comprehensive migration system schema
      - 6 tables: migration_jobs, migration_files, migration_records, migration_field_mappings, migration_conflicts, migration_logs
      - RLS policies and helper functions

   - `/Users/Sam/app/settings/migrations/page.tsx`
      - Migration wizard UI with 4-step process
      - File upload handler with validation
      - Instructions for GoTeamUp data export
      ```typescript
      const handleFileUpload = async (event: React.ChangeEvent<HTMLInputElement>) => {
        const file = event.target.files?.[0];
        // Validate file type and size (100MB max)
        const validTypes = ["text/csv", "application/vnd.ms-excel", 
          "application/vnd.openxmlformats-officedocument.spreadsheetml.sheet"];
      ```

   - `/Users/Sam/app/components/settings/SettingsSidebar.tsx`
      - Added Migrations link to settings navigation
      - Created new DATA category for migration-related settings
      ```typescript
      {
        category: "DATA",
        items: [
          { name: "Migrations", href: "/settings/migrations", icon: Upload },
          { name: "Data & Privacy", href: "/settings/data", icon: Database },
        ]
      }
      ```

4. **Errors and Fixes:**
   - **ERROR: column "lead_id" does not exist**
     - Fixed by creating simpler version without lead_id references
   
   - **ERROR: column "sent_at" does not exist**
     - Fixed by removing sent_at references and using only existing columns
   
   - **ERROR: unterminated quoted string at "doesn't"**
     - Fixed by removing all apostrophes from SQL comments
   
   - **ERROR: column reference "conversation_id" is ambiguous**
     - Fixed by using unique column aliases in CTEs
   
   - **ERROR: structure of query does not match function result type**
     - Fixed with explicit CAST operations to TEXT
   
   - **Migrations tab not visible in settings**
     - Fixed by updating SettingsSidebar component to include Migrations link

5. **Problem Solving:**
   - **Solved**: Messages stuck in "pending" - created triggers to auto-deliver in-app messages
   - **Solved**: Conversations not loading - created get_all_conversations function
   - **Solved**: Dark mode not applied - updated all className attributes
   - **Solved**: Missing "In-App" option - added as default messaging type
   - **Solved**: Migration system implementation - complete database schema and UI created
   - **Solved**: Settings navigation - added Migrations tab under DATA category
   - **Ongoing**: Vercel deployment warnings about Edge Runtime compatibility

6. **All User Messages:**

     5â†’// Public routes that don't require authentication

    39â†’]
    40â†’
    41â†’// Client-only routes
    42â†’const clientRoutes = [
    43â†’  '/client'
    44â†’]
    45â†’
    46â†’// Debug and test routes - these should be blocked in production
    47â†’const debugRoutes = [
    48â†’  '/bypass-login',
    49â†’  '/test-login',
    50â†’  '/quick-login',
    51â†’  '/direct-dashboard',
    52â†’  '/auth-debug',
    53â†’  '/auth-check',
    54â†’  '/whatsapp-debug',
    55â†’  '/membership-debug',
    56â†’  '/memberships-debug',
    57â†’  '/booking-debug',
    58â†’  '/classes-debug',
    59â†’  '/facebook-debug',
    60â†’  '/test-analytics',
    61â†’  '/call-test',
    62â†’  '/auth-test',
    63â†’  '/membership-create-test',
    64â†’  '/test-memberships',
    65â†’  '/test-client',
    66â†’  '/test-whatsapp-ai',
    67â†’  '/create-test-classes',
    68â†’  '/test-workflows',
    69â†’  '/test-styles',
    70â†’  '/workflow-test',
    71â†’  '/nutrition-test',
    72â†’  '/quick-add-class',
    73â†’  '/sql-check',
    74â†’  '/seed-knowledge',
    75â†’  '/fix-messages',
    76â†’  '/get-started',
    77â†’  '/emergency'
    78â†’]
    79â†’
    80â†’// Admin routes that require organization
    81â†’const adminRoutes = [
    82â†’  '/dashboard',
    83â†’  '/leads',
    84â†’  '/messages',
    85â†’  '/conversations',  // Add conversations route
    86â†’  '/automations',
    87â†’  '/calendar',
    88â†’  '/booking',
    89â†’  '/staff',
    90â†’  '/forms',
    91â†’  '/settings',
    92â†’  '/billing',
    93â†’  '/memberships',
    94â†’  '/members',      // Add members route
    95â†’  '/ai-config',
    96â†’  '/classes',
    97â†’  '/customers',
    98â†’  '/integrations'  // Add integrations to admin routes
    99â†’]
   100â†’
   101â†’// Super admin routes that bypass organization checks
   102â†’const superAdminRoutes = [
   103â†’  '/admin'
   104â†’]
   105â†’
   106â†’export async function middleware(request: NextRequest) {
   107â†’  const { pathname } = request.nextUrl
   108â†’  const res = NextResponse.next()
   109â†’  
   110â†’  // Block debug routes in production or if not explicitly enabled
   111â†’  const isDebugRoute = debugRoutes.some(route => 
   112â†’    pathname === route || pathname.startsWith(route + '/')
   113â†’  )
   114â†’  
   115â†’  // Also block debug API routes - but allow specific test endpoints
   116â†’  const allowedTestEndpoints = [
   117â†’    '/api/test-email',
   118â†’    '/api/test-welcome',
   119â†’    '/api/debug-welcome',
   120â†’    '/api/simple-test',
   121â†’    '/api/ping',
   122â†’    '/api/email-status',
   123â†’    '/api/check-magic-link'
   124â†’  ]
   125â†’  
   126â†’  const isAllowedTestEndpoint = allowedTestEndpoints.some(endpoint => pathname === endpoint)
   127â†’  
   128â†’  const isDebugApiRoute = !isAllowedTestEndpoint && (
   129â†’    pathname.startsWith('/api/debug/') || 
   130â†’    pathname.startsWith('/api/test/') ||
   131â†’    pathname.startsWith('/api/quick-add-class')
   132â†’  )
   133â†’  
   134â†’  if (isDebugRoute || isDebugApiRoute) {
   135â†’    // Only allow debug routes in development or if ENABLE_DEBUG_ROUTES=true
   136â†’    const isDevelopment = process.env.NODE_ENV === 'development'
   137â†’    const debugEnabled = process.env.ENABLE_DEBUG_ROUTES === 'true'
   138â†’    
   139â†’    if (!isDevelopment && !debugEnabled) {
   140â†’      if (isDebugApiRoute) {
   141â†’        return NextResponse.json({ error: 'Debug API routes are disabled in production' }, { status: 403 })
   142â†’      }
   143â†’      return NextResponse.redirect(new URL('/login', request.url))
   144â†’    }
   145â†’  }
   146â†’  
   147â†’  // Check if route is public
   148â†’  const isPublicRoute = publicRoutes.some(route => 
   149â†’    pathname === route || pathname.startsWith(route + '/')
   150â†’  )
   151â†’  
   152â†’  if (isPublicRoute) {
   153â†’    return res
   154â†’  }
   155â†’
   156â†’  // Create supabase client
   157â†’  const supabase = createMiddlewareClient(request, res)
   158â†’
   159â†’  // Get session and refresh if needed
   160â†’  const {
   161â†’    data: { session },
   162â†’  } = await supabase.auth.getSession()
   163â†’
   164â†’  // If no session, try to get user and refresh
   165â†’  if (!session) {
   166â†’    const { data: { user } } = await supabase.auth.getUser()
   167â†’    
   168â†’    if (user) {
   169â†’      // User exists but session expired, try to refresh
   170â†’      const { data: { session: refreshedSession } } = await supabase.auth.refreshSession()
   171â†’      
   172â†’      if (refreshedSession) {
   173â†’        // Successfully refreshed, continue with the request
   174â†’        return res
   175â†’      }
   176â†’    }
   177â†’    
   178â†’    // No session and couldn't refresh - return 401 for API, redirect to login for pages
   179â†’    if (pathname.startsWith('/api/')) {
   180â†’      return NextResponse.json({ error: 'Unauthorized' }, { status: 401 })
   181â†’    }
   182â†’    const redirectUrl = new URL('/login', request.url)
   183â†’    redirectUrl.searchParams.set('redirect', pathname)
   184â†’    return NextResponse.redirect(redirectUrl)
   185â†’  }
   186â†’
   187â†’  // Check if user is trying to access super admin routes
   188â†’  const isSuperAdminRoute = superAdminRoutes.some(route => 
   189â†’    pathname.startsWith(route)
   190â†’  )
   191â†’
   192â†’  if (isSuperAdminRoute) {
   193â†’    // For super admin routes, just check if user is authenticated
   194â†’    // The page itself will handle specific email checks
   195â†’    return res
   196â†’  }
   197â†’
   198â†’  // Check if user is trying to access client routes
   199â†’  const isClientRoute = clientRoutes.some(route => 
   200â†’    pathname.startsWith(route)
   201â†’  )
   202â†’
   203â†’  if (isClientRoute) {
   204â†’    // Check if user is a client (has client_id in metadata or is linked to a client)
   205â†’    const { data: client } = await supabase
   206â†’      .from('clients')
   207â†’      .select('id')
   208â†’      .eq('user_id', session.user.id)
   209â†’      .single()
   210â†’
   211â†’    if (!client) {
   212â†’      // Not a client, redirect to main dashboard
   213â†’      return NextResponse.redirect(new URL('/dashboard', request.url))
   214â†’    }
   215â†’    
   216â†’    return res
   217â†’  }
   218â†’
   219â†’  // Special handling for setup-account route (bypasses org check)
   220â†’  if (pathname === '/setup-account' || pathname.startsWith('/api/admin/link-sam-account') || pathname.startsWith('/api/admin/setup-sam-account')) {
   221â†’    return res
   222â†’  }
   223â†’
   224â†’  // Check if user is trying to access admin routes
   225â†’  const isAdminRoute = adminRoutes.some(route => 
   226â†’    pathname.startsWith(route)
   227â†’  )
   228â†’
   229â†’  if (isAdminRoute) {
   230â†’    // Check if user has an organization - check both tables
   231â†’    let userOrg = null;
   232â†’    
   233â†’    // First check organization_staff table (new structure)
   234â†’    const { data: staffOrg } = await supabase
   235â†’      .from('organization_staff')
   236â†’      .select('organization_id, role')
   237â†’      .eq('user_id', session.user.id)
   238â†’      .eq('is_active', true)
   239â†’      .single()
   240â†’    
   241â†’    if (staffOrg) {
   242â†’      userOrg = staffOrg;
   243â†’    } else {
   244â†’      // Fallback to organization_members table (old structure)
   245â†’      const { data: memberOrg } = await supabase
   246â†’        .from('organization_members')
   247â†’        .select('organization_id, role')
   248â†’        .eq('user_id', session.user.id)
   249â†’        .eq('is_active', true)
   250â†’        .single()
   251â†’      
   252â†’      if (memberOrg) {
   253â†’        userOrg = memberOrg;
   254â†’      }
   255â†’    }
   256â†’
   257â†’    if (!userOrg) {
   258â†’      // User doesn't belong to any organization; require onboarding and do NOT auto-associate
   259â†’      if (pathname.startsWith('/api/')) {
   260â†’        return NextResponse.json({ error: 'Organization required' }, { status: 403 })
   261â†’      }
   262â†’      const redirectUrl = new URL('/onboarding/create-organization', request.url)
   263â†’      redirectUrl.searchParams.set('redirect', pathname)
   264â†’      return NextResponse.redirect(redirectUrl)
   265â†’    }
   266â†’
   267â†’    // Store organization ID in headers for API routes
   268â†’    if (userOrg) {
   269â†’      res.headers.set('x-organization-id', userOrg.organization_id)
   270â†’      res.headers.set('x-user-role', userOrg.role)
   271â†’    }
   272â†’  }
   273â†’
   274â†’  return res
   275â†’}
   276â†’
   277â†’export const config = {
   278â†’  matcher: [
   279â†’    /*
   280â†’     * Match all request paths except for the ones starting with:
   281â†’     * - _next/static (static files)
   282â†’     * - _next/image (image optimization files)
   283â†’     * - favicon.ico (favicon file)
   284â†’     * - public folder
   285â†’     */
   286â†’    '/((?!_next/static|_next/image|favicon.ico|public).*)',
   287â†’  ],
   288â†’}

1â†’import { createServerClient, type CookieOptions } from '@supabase/ssr'
     2â†’import { NextResponse } from 'next/server'
     3â†’import type { NextRequest } from 'next/server'
     4â†’import type { Database } from './database.types'
     5â†’
     6â†’export function createMiddlewareClient(request: NextRequest, response: NextResponse) {
     7â†’  return createServerClient<Database>(
     8â†’    process.env.NEXT_PUBLIC_SUPABASE_URL!,
     9â†’    process.env.NEXT_PUBLIC_SUPABASE_ANON_KEY!,
    10â†’    {
    11â†’      cookies: {
    12â†’        get(name: string) {
    13â†’          return request.cookies.get(name)?.value
    14â†’        },
    15â†’        set(name: string, value: string, options: CookieOptions) {
    16â†’          // Set cookie on both request and response
    17â†’          request.cookies.set({
    18â†’            name,
    19â†’            value,
    20â†’            ...options,
    21â†’          })
    22â†’          response.cookies.set({
    23â†’            name,
    24â†’            value,
    25â†’            ...options,
    26â†’          })
    27â†’        },
    28â†’        remove(name: string, options: CookieOptions) {
    29â†’          // Remove cookie from both request and response
    30â†’          request.cookies.set({
    31â†’            name,
    32â†’            value: '',
    33â†’            ...options,
    34â†’          })
    35â†’          response.cookies.set({
    36â†’            name,
    37â†’            value: '',
    38â†’            ...options,
    39â†’          })
    40â†’        },
    41â†’      },
    42â†’    }
    43â†’  )
    44â†’}
